intro: Tetranema nutans, commonly known as the prostrate tetranema, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant features small, opposite leaves and produces clusters of white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments and is often found in coastal areas. Its botanical characteristics make it a valuable species for ecological studies and ornamental horticulture.
